thread.title: cristian mohaded embryonic objects to be exhibited in praxis gallery
thread.title_full: cristian mohaded embryonic objects to be exhibited in praxis gallery

title: cristian mohaded embryonic objects to be exhibited in praxis gallery
text:
cristian mohaded's embryonic objects to be exhibited in praxis gallery, buenos aires feb 22, 2017 cristian mohaded's embryonic objects to be exhibited in praxis gallery, buenos aires 
argentine designer and artist cristian mohaded is set to present his first individual exhibition titled ‘embryonic objects’ in praxis gallery, buenos aires. the artworks delve into a process of personal design and creation, intimately linked to the sensitivity of the materials and the relationship that emerges between them and their ‘maker’. 
cristian mohaded embryonic objects: translation, in recycled leather, metal and MDF 

curated for architect martin zanotti , the embryonic objects by cristian mohaded shed light on another dimension of materiality . whether by means of anonymous or liquid pieces, the designs flow into the imagination of those who contemplate them — no longer perceiving them as objects but rather as physical manifestations. to elaborate, the artist explains it as follows: ‘ embryo is that which constitutes the origin of a thing before it is created or constituted, or that is in its initial phase and still does not have the characteristics that will shape it definitively ‘. 
detail of the recycled leather laser cuts 

furthermore, the embryonic piece can be identified as an ‘anti-object’ that combats the concretization of something evading the real world and humans’ cultural habitat . in the words of architect kengo kuma , ‘ no particular skill or effort is required to turn something into an object. preventing a thing from becoming an object is a far more difficult task .’ by taking the creative factor as the engine of any design process, forgetting pre-set goals is essential to explore the material on a wide terrain. or to put it in another way, by de-contextualizing the physical element and avoiding the problem-solving epidemic, one can be met with creative, productive and unstructured thinking. the exhibition is expected to begin the 3rd of march 2017 at the praxis gallery of buenos aires city, in argentina.

distortion, nylon fringes – material reuse of a rug and wood manufacturer
